revised_title: Impurities, Segregation, and Creep Embrittlement in Materials
tldr: This article discusses the effects of impurities and segregation on the creep embrittlement of materials. The author examines various studies and theories on the topic, focusing on the role of elements such as phosphorus, tin, and antimony. The article also explores the mechanisms of surface segregation and its impact on cavity formation and material properties.
